bibl.title: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, May 7, 1952

div1.p: Rath sends Hench a copy of his report to the National Trust on his visit to the Rojas San Jose farm, and will write-up the full story for Hench as soon as he has time.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, May 7, 1952

Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I know how impatiently you must be waiting for
some report on my trip last week. As I believe I told you,
upon my return from Cuba I had to go up to New England, which
explains the delay in writing.

To save labor, I am enclosing a copy of a just-
completed report to Mr. Finley and General Grant on the trip.
That gives you the outline and the proposals. I know that you
would be interested in the surrounding details, but during this
particularly busy week I simply cannot give you the full story.

But I should like to say that it was a very great
privilege to be with Senora Rojas last week. More than a privi-
lege really, for I tremendously enjoyed meeting the whole group,
all of whom sent their very special regards to you.

My report indicates that I alone cannot give any
answers until after the Trustees meet on Saturday and express
their views. You may expect to hear from me again after that
meeting, when there should be more time.
div1.closer:
Hastily Frederick L. Rath, Jr.
